name: GraphQL Gateway
description: A Salsify service that uses Apollo Federation to serve a unified 'supergraph' composed of disparate GraphQL APIs from microservices. At runtime, the Gateway decomposes GraphQL requests into one or more subgraph GraphQL requests and returns the unified results to the client. It consists of two components: the Router (Apollo Router instance) and the Coprocessor (Go HTTP server for Salsify-specific logic like organization segmentation and JWT scoping).

name: Configuration Manifest Service
description: A Salsify microservice that manages configuration manifests. It exposes a federated GraphQL subgraph that integrates with the GraphQL Gateway, providing configuration manifest data for accounts and organizations.

name: GraphQL Gateway Coprocessor
description: An HTTP server written in Go that provides a hook into the Apollo Router for Salsify-specific logic. It is primarily responsible for applying organization segmentation by splitting operations by organization and generating organization-scoped JWTs. Runs as a sidecar container alongside the Router in Kubernetes pods.

name: Infrastructure Management Platform
description: Salsify's internal platform for managing service infrastructure and deployments. Services like the GraphQL Gateway can be monitored and managed through this platform.

name: JSON Web Token (Salsify Context)
description: In Salsify's GraphQL Gateway context, JWTs are used for authentication with two scopes: non-organization scoped JWTs (used by the API Gateway for initial routing) and organization-scoped JWTs (generated by the Coprocessor for services that require organization-level authorization).
